text:
If you're watching this video right now
you are probably under some sort of

lockdown or quarantine unable to leave
the house with far too much time on your

hands many of you are probably treating
this like it's a sort of holiday doing

nothing all day watching videos playing
games and surf in social media but the

thing is this is no holiday there is a
worldwide crisis going on and I am a

firm believer that whenever there is
some trouble up and about that one

should be spending a good chunk of their
time sharpening their axe getting ready

for what's about to come most of you
will have months and potentially even a

year of free time on your hands before
things return to the way they were

before you should be using at least some
of this free time focused on bettering

yourself so that you can emerge from
this crisis stronger and better than

ever before so that you're in a better
position to recover from whatever

happens next so today I want to issue a
challenge to those of you that want to

make the best out of this situation I
call it the quarantine challenge and

here are the rules first I want you to
take out a piece of paper draw a line

down the middle horizontally and
vertically and assess the four areas of

your life as of today on a scale of one
to ten take your time to really think

about where you currently stand for each
of these areas the first is health which

focuses on your physical health do you
exercise at all are you over healthy

weight what is your diet like are you
happy with the way you look and feel

physically the next is wealth here you
should think about your current savings

and also future income streams do you
have any form of income still coming in

are you prepared at all for a recession
if we were to answer one do you have an

emergency fund the third is
relationships here you should think

about the social support system that you
currently have in your life do you have

someone close that you can trust and can
talk to do you have a good relationship

with your parents or siblings or someone
in your family do you have friends that

you can chat with to pass the time and
finally we have happiness which focuses

on your mental health do you feel
anxious about the uncertainty in the

world right now are you currently
dealing with any mental obstacles that

are weighing you down preventing you
from taking action are you happy

take your time and really carefully
assess yourself in these

four areas and maybe even write down a
couple of sentences for each of them to

flesh out your thoughts rate yourself on
a scale of one to ten for each and after

doing so I want you to focus your
attention on the one area that you rated

yourself the lowest on this will be the
primary focus for the quarantine

challenge and also make sure to keep
this sheet of paper I'll tell you why in

a minute your next step is to figure out
which one habit would help improve your

rating in this area the most let's say
for example you analyze your life and

you realize that your wealth or your
current financial situation is the one

area that you're most worried about you
got laid off and you barely have any

savings so you rated yourself a two on a
scale of ten this means that your

primary focus for this challenge should
be to improve your financial situation

as much as possible this is the best
thing that you could be doing right now

with your free time so now that you
figure this out your next task is to ask

yourself this which one habit could I
build that would help me improve the

financial aspect of my life the most
well off the top of my head there are a

couple things you could do building a
habit of reading could help write

reading financial education books would
give you a better understanding about

the current world situation it would
teach you about the best things you

should be doing with your money and it
would also give you more ideas for

making money even during this period of
uncertainty another habit that might

work for the challenge could be to pick
up a skill something that could make you

money even if we were all hypothetically
locked down for another year ideally

something that is recession-proof that
could be done remotely now you would

have to do your own research on this
subject but spending some time every day

learning such a skill would absolutely
position yourself to be in a better

place financially if we were thrown into
a long lasting recession take your time

figuring out which one habit would help
you out the most when you do so make

sure to comment down below under this
video so that you can be held

accountable this is the habit that you
will focus on for the Quarantine

challenge your job is to spend at least
30 minutes a day doing this one thing

once you do so you can enjoy as much
relaxation or entertainment as you want

that will be your reward what's
important is that you enjoy your reward

only after doing
at least 30 minutes of whatever you've

challenged yourself to work on and
finally as a way to track yourself

during this challenge I want you to take
out a piece of paper and draw out a

calendar for the rest of this month you
can even find an empty calendar that you

have lying around or print one from
online place it in a place that you

frequent often and use it as a tracking
tool you can use exes check marks or

even fill up the entire box it's up to
you your goal for the quarantine

challenge is to stick to your habit as
much as possible during this lockdown

notice how I use the word as much as
possible I do not believe in counting

streaks your goal is to try and stick to
your habit for at least 90% of the days

for the remainder of the time you're
locked down this means every month you

can miss up to three days if you do miss
a day for whatever reason do not be hard

on yourself nobody is perfect miss days
are to be expected but when it happens

remember that piece of paper where you
broke down the four areas of your life

yeah when you miss a day simply take a
look at the paper and remind yourself

why you're taking on this challenge in
the first place why you need to improve

this area of your life why you need to
emerge from this crisis stronger and

better than before take your time and
really think about that and then make

sure you stick to your habit the next
day now I usually do not recommend

building more than one habit at once but
because of the extraordinary amount of

free time that some of you might have
due to the current situation I think

it's safe for some of you to try and
build two habits at the same time right

now if you're up for the challenge
for example let's say after analyzing

your life you realize that your health
isn't that great either so you could

work on reading at least 30 minutes
every day to help improve the financial

aspect of your life and you could also
adopt eight thirty plus minute

bodyweight fitness workout at home to
improve your health I do not recommend

trying to build more than two habits at
once even if you have a tremendous

amount of free time as multitasking with
that many things is usually a recipe for

disaster
and if any of you wants to help in

regards to building habits you can refer
to the team course which I will link to

in the description down below this video
is brought to you if to help the guys at

autumn
using audible to listen to audiobooks

it's one of the best habits you can
build right now for the quarantine

challenge regardless of what area of
your life you want to focus on improving

they have audiobooks on just about every
conceivable self-improvement subject you

can think of if you want to take
advantage of all the free time you have

I suggest you go to
www.mptv.org/outdoorwisconsin challenge

which is why the book I'm currently
listening to is the simple path to

wealth by JL Collins which is considered
to be one of the best books to read when

it comes to investing I highly recommend
you guys to check it out if you want to

improve your financial education as well
and besides that guys I wish you the

best of luck with the quarantine
challenge and I look forward to reading

about your experience in the comments in
future videos
